title: Traditional Greek Salad
description: Fresh and vibrant Mediterranean salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, feta cheese, and a simple olive oil dressing. Perfect as a side or light meal.

ingredients.item: green bell pepper, cut into rings

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine tomato wedges, cucumber slices, red onion, and bell pepper rings.
Add Kalamata olives to the vegetables.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over vegetables and gently toss to combine.
Place feta cheese block on top of the salad or crumble it over the vegetables.
Drizzle with a little more olive oil, sprinkle with oregano, and serve immediately. Best enjoyed fresh!

notes: Use the ripest tomatoes you can find for maximum flavor.
Authentic Greek salad doesn't have lettuce - it's all about the vegetables and feta.
Let the salad sit for 10-15 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld.
Use a block of feta cheese and break it into chunks rather than pre-crumbled feta for better texture.

faqs.question: Can I add lettuce to this salad?
faqs.answer: Traditional Greek salad (Horiatiki) doesn't include lettuce, but you can add it if you prefer. Use crisp romaine or iceberg.

faqs.question: How long will this keep?
faqs.answer: The salad is best eaten fresh, but you can prepare all the vegetables and store them separately from the dressing for up to 1 day. Dress just before serving.

faqs.question: What kind of olives should I use?
faqs.answer: Kalamata olives are traditional and provide the authentic flavor, but any good quality Greek olive will work.
